FILE: cm713816v11.0.txt
DYAD: TAIWAN - N. VIETNAM
RIVALRY: RIV1318
DISPUTE(S): MID4331 MID4060 

PS: 19750501-19950325 .25 19950326-20000325 .50

PSNOTES: Vietnam :inherited the Spratley Island disputes from South Vietnam and the lesser rivalry ends when the dispute is no longer militarized between them, the end of the last dispute.

PS-UPDATE2020: Revision based on a new relationship rule that when a rivalry terminates and the rivalry is the only basis for a relationship, then the relationship continues for 5 years and is coded as negative peace (.5) and then the relationship ends thereafter.



PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220325
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220325

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4331

TERRMID: MID4331 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4331 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4331 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4331 from Gibler 2018, in 1994 Taiwan and Vietnam seized fishing vessels from each other's country, and Taiwan responded by dispatching police patrols to the disputed waters. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime dispute. 

ISLMID: MID4331 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4331 coded not islands because, although the islands in the disputed waters were also disputed, this MID does not involve those islands directly. 

CIVWARMID: MID4331 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4331 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4331 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4331 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4331 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4060

TERRMID: MID4060 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4060 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4060 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4060 coded maritime MID because the Spratly Islands were disputed due to maritime boundary implications. 

ISLMID: MID4060 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4060 from Gibler 2018, in 1995 Taiwan announced that they would use police vessels to defend their claim over the Spratly Islands. Taiwan fired warning shots at a Vietnamese vessel. Coded islands MID because this was connected to a dispute over the Spratly Islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID4060 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4060 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4060 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4060 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4060 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4331
rivalry=713816 nationa=TAIWAN nationb=N. VIETNAM MID4331 19940416-19940428 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=TERRITORY revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

This dispute is related to a show of force by Taiwan against Vietnam. Taiwan dispatched a pair of police patrol boats to the Spratly Islands in the South China Sea in order to protect Taiwanese fishing vessels and re-assert its claim over the disputed islands, Taiwan's United Daily News report says. Taiwanese police mentioned that the dispatch aimed at checking the safety of a route to the island in the wake of seizure of Taiwanese vessels by Philippines and Vietnam. First day of dispute was on 4/16/1994 and last day of dispute was on 4/28/1994.

MID4060
rivalry=713816 nationa=TAIWAN nationb=N. VIETNAM MID4060 19950325-19950325 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=TERRITORY revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

The dispute is based on a show of force by Taiwan on a Vietnamese vessel that entered waters claimed by Taiwan. Taiwanese military fired 4 warning shots at a Vietnamese vessel that it said intruded into its sphere of influence in the disputed Spratly Islands. The issue is related to control over the islands. First and last day of dispute was on 3/25/1995.

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:
Taiwanese artillery on the Spratly island of Ban Than in the South China Sea fired on a Vietnamese supply ship on March 25, 1995. Vietnam protested the incident to Taiwan on April 4, 1995.

SOURCES-CM: 
*Keesing,* April 1995.

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
